conclusion: To find the magnitude of the normal force between the latch D and the lock groove E during self-locking.
The spring force Fs = kx acts horizontally, pushing the latch into the lock groove.
The normal force N acts perpendicular to the surface of the latch.
The frictional force f = μN opposes the sliding motion.
The force F is applied to move the door.

premise: The normal force N and frictional force f can be resolved into components.
conclusion: Horizontal component of N and f.

premise: The normal force N and frictional force f can be resolved into components.
conclusion: Vertical component of N and f.
The component of the normal force perpendicular to the inclined surface is N cos θ.
The component of friction f = μN parallel to the inclined surface is N sin θ.

premise: For the system to be in equilibrium, the horizontal components must balance.
conclusion: kx = N cos θ + μN sin θ

premise: kx = N cos θ + μN sin θ with θ = 30°.
Rearrange the equation kx = N (√3/2 + μ/2) to solve for N.
The magnitude of the normal force N between the latch and the lock groove at the moment of self-locking.
